title: Dialog launches Sri Lanka’s largest 5G network, connecting over 1.5 million subscribers
byline: Dialog Axiata PLC today announced the commercial launch of Dialog 5G Ultra, marking a major milestone in the country’s digital evolution and its transition into the 5G era.

title: US announces $11 billion arms package for Taiwan, largest ever
byline: The Trump administration announced on Wednesday $11.1 billion in arms sales to Taiwan, the largest ever U.S. weapons package for the island which is under increasing military pressure from China.

title: Schools in Central Province closed tomorrow and Monday
byline: A decision has been taken to close all schools in the Central Province on Friday (December 19) and Monday due to the prevailing inclement weather conditions, says the Chief Secretary of the Central Province.

title: 53-year-old man stabbed to death in Kotahena
byline: A 53-year-old man has been stabbed to death this evening (18) in the 6th Lane area of Kotahena, police said.

title: Suspects remanded for setting fire to wild elephant in Mihinthale
byline: The Anuradhapura Magistrate’s Court has ordered that the three suspects arrested in connection with the alleged torture and setting fire to a wild elephant in the Sippukulama area of Mihintale be remanded until December 24.

title: Police warn against misuse of ‘119’ hotline; Legal action against offenders
byline: Sri Lanka Police says it has observed significant misuse of the ‘119’ emergency hotline by certain members of the public, prompting the need for greater public awareness and enforcement action.

title: Two Sri Lankan fishing vessels seized by Maldivian Coast Guard after foreign intelligence tip
byline: Two Sri Lankan fishing vessels were seized near Kelaa in Haa Alifu Atoll yesterday during an operation conducted by the Maldives National Defence Force (MNDF) based on intelligence shared by foreign sources, Maldivian media reported today.

title: Flood warning issued for several low-lying areas of Mahaweli River Basin
byline: The Irrigation Department has issued a flood warning valid for the next 48 hours for several low-lying areas along the Mahaweli River Basin due to rainfall received since last night (17) in certain catchment areas.

title: TikTok signs deal to sell US unit to American investor-led venture
byline: TikTok’s Chinese owner, ByteDance, signed binding agreements with three major investors to sell just over 80% of the company’s U.S. assets to American and global investors to avoid a U.S. government ban, TikTok CEO Shou Zi Chew told employees on Thursday.

title: Seven dead in fatal plane crash including former NASCAR driver Greg Biffle
byline: Seven people were killed Thursday in the crash of a Cessna 550 business jet in Statesville, North Carolina, including former NASCAR driver Greg Biffle, NASCAR said.

title: Violence breaks out in Bangladesh after death of youth protest leader
byline: Violence has erupted in Bangladesh following the death of a prominent leader of the youth movement that ousted former Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina.

title: Fairly heavy rainfall expected in parts of the island today
byline: Showers will occur at times in Eastern, Uva and Central provinces and in Polonnaruwa and Hambantota districts, today (19), the Department of Meteorology said.

title: Suspected gunman in Brown University shooting found dead, official says
byline: The suspect in the mass shooting at Brown University last weekend is dead, a U.S. attorney said, as authorities investigate whether the same person killed a Massachusetts Institute of Technology professor two days after the rampage at Brown.

title: IMF Executive Board to review Sri Lanka’s US$ 200 mln emergency financing request today
byline: The Executive Board of the International Monetary Fund (IMF) is scheduled to review the government’s request for emergency financial assistance amounting to SDR 150.5 million (approximately USD 200 million) under the Rapid Financing Instrument (RFI) today (19), according to the IMF Executive Board calendar.

title: Dasun Shanaka to captain Sri Lanka T20 team until 2026 World Cup
byline: Sri Lanka Cricket (SLC) Chief Selector Pramodya Wickremesinghe has confirmed that Dasun Shanaka will continue as the captain of the Sri Lanka T20I squad until the conclusion of the 2026 T20I World Cup.

title: National Hospital’s Deputy Director Dr. Bellana suspended from duties
byline: Measures have been taken to suspend the official duties of Dr. Rukshan Bellana, who served as the Deputy Director of the Colombo National Hospital.

title: Highest rainfall in past 24 hours recorded in Udadumbara
byline: The highest rainfall recorded during the 24-hour period ending at 6.00 a.m. today (19) was reported from the Udadumbara area, according to the Disaster Management Centre (DMC).

title: ‘Rebuilding Sri Lanka’ Fund surpasses Rs. 4.2 billion – Finance Secretary
byline: The ‘Rebuilding Sri Lanka’ Fund, established by the government to provide relief to those affected by recent disasters caused by Cyclone Ditwah, has received a total of Rs. 4,286 million to date, Finance Secretary Dr. Harshana Suriyapperuma said.

title: Landslides reported in Udadumbara and Walapane; Residents urged to remain vigilant
byline: The National Building Research Organization (NBRO) has confirmed that several landslides have occurred in the Udadumbara area of Kandy, following rainfall exceeding 300 millimeters over the past 48 hours.

title: Facebook tests £9.99 monthly subscription for sharing more than two links
byline: Facebook is testing placing a limit on how many links some users can share when they post on the social media platform.

title: Keith Lee named ‘creator of the year’ at first-ever US TikTok awards
byline: Content creators across dance, music, sports, fashion, entertainment and education gathered in Hollywood on Thursday for the first U.S. TikTok Awards, featuring Labubu dolls launched from a T-shirt cannon, a giant selfie challenge, skits, and viral moment reenactments.

title: GovPay surpasses Rs. 2 billion in digital transactions in 2025 – Digital Economy Ministry
byline: GovPay, Sri Lanka’s Government Digital Payment Platform, has concluded the year 2025 by surpassing Rs. 2 billion in total digital transaction value, marking a major milestone in the country’s digital transformation journey, the Ministry of Digital Economy said.

title: Trump suspends green card lottery program that let Brown University, MIT shootings suspect into US
byline: President Donald Trump suspended the green card lottery program on Thursday that allowed the suspect in the Brown University and MIT shootings to come to the United States.

title: Wiz Khalifa sentenced to nine months jail in Romania for smoking cannabis on stage
byline: A Romanian court has sentenced Wiz Khalifa to nine months in prison for smoking cannabis on stage.

title: CoPF approves supplementary estimate of Rs. 500 billion
byline: The Committee on Public Finance (CoPF) has approved a supplementary estimate of Rs. 500 billion to restore the livelihoods of those affected by the sudden disaster, the Department of Communication of Parliament said in a statement.

title: ‘Unofficial Magistrate’: BASL condemns Kaduwela Mayor’s claim
byline: The Bar Association of Sri Lanka (BASL) today expressed its deep concern regarding the treatment of an Attorney-at-Law who “faced obstruction and hindrance” while representing an Animal Welfare Association at an inquiry conducted by the Mayor of the Kaduwela Municipal Council, Ranjan Jayalal Perera.

title: Train services to resume between Badulla and Ambewela from tomorrow
byline: The Department of Railways has decided to operate train services between Badulla and Ambewela along the Upcountry Railway Line from tomorrow (20).

title: President to attend parliamentary debate on supplementary estimate
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake is scheduled to attend parliament today (19) and deliver a special statement, according to the President’s Media Division.

title: Earthquake jolts northern Afghanistan
byline: A 5.3-magnitude earthquake struck parts of Afghanistan early on Friday, including the capital Kabul, according to the US Geological Survey.

title: Over 29,000 businesses affected by Cyclone Ditwah – Industry Ministry
byline: The Ministry of Industry and Entrepreneurship Development has revealed that 29,649 places of business including registered export manufacturing factories across Sri Lanka have been affected by Cyclone Ditwah.

title: Not possible to abolish executive presidential system without introducing new constitution - PM
byline: Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya stated that steps are being taken to abolish the Executive Presidency and establish a parliamentary system of government, including the appointment of a President without executive powers.

title: Rs. 500 billion Supplementary Estimate approved in Parliament
byline: The Supplementary Estimate of Rs. 500 billion to restore the livelihoods of those affected by the sudden disaster situation and to rebuild destroyed infrastructure, presented to Parliament yesterday for the approval of Parliament, was approved in Parliament today (19).

title: Somawathiya-Sungavila road to remain closed for vehicles
byline: Vehicular movement along the Somawathiya - Sungavila main road has been further suspended after the roadway leading to the historic Somawathiya Chaitya was inundated by rising floodwater.

title: Flood warning extended for low-lying areas of Mahaweli River Basin
byline: The Department of Irrigation has announced that the flood warning issued for several low-lying areas along the Mahaweli River Basin has been extended for a further 24 hours.

title: Detention order issued on Sampath Manamperi extended
byline: Sampath Manamperi, who is currently in the custody of the Police Western Province North Crimes Division over allegations of concealing two containers of raw materials allegedly used in the production of the drug “Ice” (crystal methamphetamine) and possession of weapons, was produced before the Walasmulla Magistrate’s Court today (19).

title: Showers expected in several provinces tomorrow
byline: Several spells of showers will occur in the Eastern, Uva and Central provinces and in Polonnaruwa and Hambantota districts tomorrow (20), according to the Department of Meteorology.

title: Rs. 50,000 allowance for 3 months for over 17,000 homes impacted by disaster: President
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake says that families of a 17,648 homes identified as completely destroyed, partially damaged or designated as unsafe by the NBRO after the recent disaster, will be provided with a monthly allowance of Rs. 50,000 for three months.

title: 2 dead, 6 injured after man stabs people, throws smoke grenade at Taiwan metro station
byline: Two people were killed and six others injured after a man carried out a stabbing attack and threw a smoke grenade at a metro station in Taiwan on Friday, local media reported.

title: IMF Executive Board approves US$206M in emergency financial support for Sri Lanka
byline: The Executive Board of the International Monetary Fund (IMF) approved a disbursement of SDR150.5 million (about US$206 million, equivalent to 26 percent of quota) for Sri Lanka under the Rapid Financing Instrument (RFI).

title: No traces of alcohol in samples obtained from MP Asoka Ranwala - Police
byline: The Police Spokesman has stated that no traces of alcohol were detected in the blood and urine samples obtained from former Speaker and National People’s Power (NPP) Parliamentarian Asoka Ranwala.
